children.value: Before we model the universe, we need to set up our computational laboratory. This module establishes the professional development environment and essential skills you‚Äôll use throughout ASTR 596 and your research career.

The difference between a computational scientist and someone who codes isn‚Äôt knowledge of Python syntax ‚Äî it‚Äôs mastery of the ecosystem. Version control, environment management, and command-line fluency aren‚Äôt just ‚Äúnice to have‚Äù skills; they fundamentally change how you approach problems, collaborate, and think about reproducible science.
Master the terminal with essential commands for file management, navigation, and automation
Install Python with Miniforge, configure VS Code, and create your isolated course environment
Version control fundamentals, GitHub Classroom workflow, and collaboration best practices

: Learn to navigate before installing anything
: Use your CLI skills to install tools
: Apply everything to manage your code
After completing this module in order, you will:
the terminal with confidence using pwd, ls, cd, and Tab completion.
a fully configured Python environment isolated from system Python.
conda environments and why they prevent dependency conflicts.
Git for every assignment submission via GitHub Classroom.
common issues independently using error messages.
why every computational scientist relies on these tools daily.
: Start with just 3 commands (pwd, ls, cd). Everything else builds on these.

and navigate to any folder using cd and ls

If you can do these five things, you have the foundation for everything in this course!
After completing this module, you‚Äôll begin the Python Fundamentals module where you‚Äôll:

Build on this foundation for the rest of your career
How to Succeed in This Module
: Setup problems compound. Better to spend an extra hour now than fight your environment all semester.
: Spend 10 minutes each day using the terminal. Muscle memory develops quickly with consistent practice.
: Make Git commits after every small success. You can‚Äôt over-commit, but you can under-commit.
: They usually tell you exactly what‚Äôs wrong. Copy the full error when asking for help.
: Document what worked for your specific system. You‚Äôll need these notes again for future projects.

: These tools aren‚Äôt just course requirements‚Äîthey‚Äôre essential skills for any scientific research career. The more you invest in mastering them now, the more prepared you‚Äôll be for real research challenges ahead.
